I am a confident, driven , proactive  Graduate Engineer  looking to apply my results focussed approach 
through a graduate scheme . I enjoy seeing the outcome of my work and the sense of accomplishment 
it brings, while listening to advice and supporting other team members to complete tasks to the 
highest quality.  I am always looking to learn new skills and expand my experiences in the workplace 
to become a more effective team member, while  actively pursuing  my own professional development 
toward s Chartered Engineer status with the IMechE  as soon as possible .

Educa tion 
2016 – 2020 : 1st Class MEng (Hons)  Master of  Mechanical Engineering (IMechE  Accredited ) 
LIVERPOOL JOHN MOORES UNIVERSITY  
• 1st year average: 92%  
• 2nd year average: 86% : Engineering Mathematics, Materials and Manufacturing Process es, 
Applied Mechanics, Engineering Practice, Thermodynamics and Fluid Mechanics, Mechanical 
Design, and Mechatronics.  
• 3rd year average: 88% : Engineering Analysis, Vehicle Dynamics, Industrial Management, 
Mechanical Design, and Thermodynamics . 
o Engineering Project: Deve lopment of stabilization augmentation system for the Puma 
Helicopter (Awarded the Institution Project Award by IMechE ). 
• 4th year average: 81%: Conventional and Alternative Energy Systems, Computational Fluid 
Dynamics, Additive Manufacturing Processes, Operations Research, and Group Project (Steam 
Cooking Integration).  
September 2013 - July 2016 : A-level, PENKETH  SIXTH FORM COLLEGE  
Math ematics  B 
Chemistry  B

13 GSCEs attained including English Language, English Literature, Mathematics, Chemistry, Biology, 
Physics,  and ICT.  
Skills  
Technical Skills 
I have developed strong skills utilizing  software such as Solidworks  to design and build mechanical 
compone nts such as battery housings and components for additive manufacturing .  
I also have a good understan ding of ANSYS F luent  and Solidworks flow simulat ion and how they can 
be u sed to model different  fluid flow conditions in both convention al mechanical systems , in addition 
to more uni que applications  such as blood flow through arteries . 
Problem Solving  
My self -lead project was to design and implement a stabilization system for a helicopter . This required  
me to identify the key requirements of the system an d ensure they could be quantified and were valid 
within the timeframe.  I then had to gain a technical understanding of helicopter control systems 
understanding how each control path would cause the system to react. The instability of the motion 
during a co ntrol input could then be resolved using a series of feedback loops along each control 
channel  using MATLAB . The system was then checked against military rotorcraft requirements to 
ensure agile handling qualities to certify that the system met the initial system requirements.   
Teamwor k 
Having worked multiple customer service jobs, I am experienced in working as a team to deliver high 
service standards in both retail and food services. These roles enabled me to develop clear 
communication skills and confide nce, dealing with both customers and other members of my team . 
Experience

• Maintaining store standards  by constantly reviewing the condition of the shopfloor.  
• Presenting  technical knowledge to custom ers about the products  sold instore . 
• Reorganized  the stock cupboard  by brand and gender  to greatly improve  service efficiency . 
 
July 2018 – October 2018: Chill ed Colleague , ASDA STORES LTD

• Effectively restocking the shelves on the shopfloor to ensure the shortest dates were sold first . 
• Working with other team members to complete shift t asks efficiently by catering to changing  
priorities throughout the day.
